Package org.neo4j.csv.reader

Class Magic

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.neo4j.csv.reader.Magic
  • public class Magic
extends Object
    Logic for detecting and matching magic numbers in file headers.

    • Method Detail

      • define

        public static Magic define​(String description,
                           Charset impliesEncoding,
                           int... bytesAsIntsForConvenience)
        Defines a magic signature which can later be detected in of(Path) and of(byte[]).
        Parameters:
        description - description of the magic, typically which file it is.
        impliesEncoding - if a match for this to-be-defined magic implies that the contents in this file has a certain encoding. Typically used for byte-order-mark.
        bytesAsIntsForConvenience - bytes that makes up the magic signature. Here specified as an int[] for convenience of specifying those.
        Returns:
        the defined Magic instance.

      • of

        public static Magic of​(Path file)
                throws IOException
        Extracts and matches the magic of the header in the given file. If no magic matches then NONE is returned.
        Parameters:
        file - Path to extract the magic from.
        Returns:
        matching Magic, or NONE if no match.
        Throws:
        IOException - for errors reading from the file.

      • of

        public static Magic of​(byte[] bytes)
        Matches the magic bytes with all defined and returns a match or NONE.
        Parameters:
        bytes - magic bytes extracted from a file header.
        Returns:
        matching Magic, or NONE if no match.

      • longest

        public static int longest()

      • matches

        public boolean matches​(byte[] candidateBytes)
        Tests whether or not a set of magic bytes matches this Magic signature.
        Parameters:
        candidateBytes - magic bytes to test.
        Returns:
        true if the candidate bytes matches this signature, otherwise false.

      • length

        public int length()
        Returns:
        number of bytes making up this magic signature.

      • impliesEncoding

        public boolean impliesEncoding()
        Returns:
        whether or not the presence of this Magic implies the contents of the file being of a certain encoding. If true then encoding() may be called to get the implied encoding.

      • encoding

        public Charset encoding()
        Returns:
        the encoding this magic signature implies, if impliesEncoding() is true, otherwise throws IllegalStateException.

      • bytes

        byte[] bytes()

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
